explanation.text: The claim asks whether a fiber battery can be made in a coaxial configuration by twisting an anode wire and a cathode wire together. This is an existential feasibility claim about device architecture.

Multiple peer-reviewed sources directly confirm that fiber batteries can be made in coaxial configurations. Specifically, sources document 'winding aligned carbon nanotube composite yarns into coaxial fiber full batteries with high performances.'

Additional sources confirm that twisted and helical fiber battery configurations are also viable, including 'twisted aligned carbon nanotube/silicon composite fiber anode' and 'cable-type flexible lithium ion battery based on hollow multi-helix electrodes.'

The literature demonstrates that fiber batteries with these geometries are functional devices that can withstand various deformations including bending, tying, and twisting, confirming structural integrity and operational feasibility.

While the claim's terminology conflates 'coaxial' (concentric/core-shell) with 'twisting together' (helical intertwining), both geometric approaches are demonstrated to be feasible and functional in the literature. The existential nature of the claim ('can be made') is satisfied by multiple documented examples.
No contradictory evidence was found showing fundamental incompatibility between twisted/coaxial geometries and battery function. All sources confirm functionality and performance.

ev1.citation: A fiber battery can be made in a coaxial configuration by twisting an anode wire and a cathode wire together.

ev2.citation: Winding aligned carbon nanotube composite yarns into coaxial fiber full batteries with high performances.

ev3.citation: Winding aligned carbon nanotube composite yarns into coaxial fiber full batteries with high performances.

ev4.citation: The fiber architecture allows batteries to be deformable in all dimensions and bear various deformations such as bending, tying, twisting and even stretching. The spring-like CNT fiber has uniform coiled loops aligning along the fiber axis and CNTs are highly aligned along the helical direction in the coiled loops.

ev5.citation: Cable-type flexible lithium ion battery based on hollow multi-helix electrodes. Twisted aligned carbon nanotube/silicon composite fiber anode for flexible wire-shaped lithium-Ion battery. Winding aligned carbon nanotube composite yarns into coaxial fiber full batteries with high performances.
